summary: Antigua and Barbuda is a Caribbean country made up of two main islands and several smaller ones. It was colonized by Great Britain and gained independence in 1981. With a population of around 97,000, most people live on the island of Antigua. The country's economy mainly relies on tourism. It is also known for its citizenship by investment program and the absence of personal income tax. Like many island nations, it faces challenges from climate change, such as rising sea levels and stronger hurricanes.
title: Antigua and Barbuda
